definition: tyrannical abuse (idiom); riding roughshod over people
worker/workshop/(slang) troublesome/high-maintenance (person)
to do/to grow/to write or compose/to pretend/to regard as/to feel/writings or works
power/might/prestige
worker/workshop/(slang) troublesome/high-maintenance (person)
to do/to grow/to write or compose/to pretend/to regard as/to feel/writings or works
good fortune/happiness/luck
surname Fu/abbr. for Fujian province 福建省[Fu2 jian4 sheng3]

sentences.english: I wouldn't work for someone who tries to domineer over everyone as Mr, Smith does.
sentences.chinese: 我不会替任何像史密斯先生那样作威作福的人工作。

sentences.english: Does evil abuses power, that is the people's public servant.
sentences.chinese: 作恶作威作福，那是人民公仆。

sentences.english: Woman once made equal to man becomes his superior.
sentences.chinese: 女人一旦得到平等，就对男人作威作福。

sentences.english: I wouldn't work for someone who tries to domineer as Mr.
sentences.chinese: 我不会替任何像史密斯先生那样作威作福的人工作。

sentences.english: But the company can be a harsh overlord to its crofters.
sentences.chinese: 但是公司对其佃户和工人可以作威作福，苛刻异常。

definition: to oppress/to rule as a despot/to tyrannize
to break the law and commit crimes (idiom); malefactor/evildoer/to perpetrate outrages
bossy and domineering/throwing one's weight about
to bully/to push around
to show off one's military strength (idiom); to strut around/to bluff/to bluster
to take advantage of one's position to bully people (idiom)/to kick people around
to run amok (idiom); to commit outrages
to oppress the people/to act tyrannically
to prey on the people
regardless of the law and of natural morality (idiom); maverick/undisciplined and out of control
local tyrant
arrogant/overbearing
lit. the fox exploits the tiger's might (idiom); fig. to use powerful connections to intimidate people
a dog threatens based on master's power (idiom); to use one's position to bully others
see 恣意妄為|恣意妄为[zi4 yi4 wang4 wei2]
lit. to order people by pointing the chin (idiom); to signal orders by facial gesture/arrogant and bossy
